intro: Hesperis leucoclada, commonly known as the white hoary bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with characteristic cruciform flowers. The plant is characterized by its pale blue to white flowers, which are typically arranged in loose clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Hesperis leucoclada is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
